subject: Re: [Re: [junit] Junit & I18N]
msgSnippet: ... about ... known ... Attilio, What is it exactly that you require from I18N enabled testing environment? What we have done with Junit is to change Locales
messageBody:
Johannes Link <john.link@...> wrote:

> ---------------------------------------------
> Attachment:�
> MIME Type:�multipart/alternative
> ---------------------------------------------


attilio mattiocco wrote:
>
> Hi, I need to know if Junit is I18N enabled, but I didn't find anything
about
> this argument on the documentation... Does anybody know if there are any
known
> problems with DBCS environments?
>
> thanks, Attilio Mattiocco

Attilio,
What is it exactly that you require from I18N enabled testing
environment?

What we have done with Junit is to change Locales and tested if strings
and dates etc. of our presentation layer objects come out correctly.
This is straightforward. What else would you like to do regarding I18N?

Johannes


Thanks Johannes,
I wasn't thinking of any particular enablement, just I was wondering if
the tool could work on "strange" environments, as well as the DBCS ones. I
argue from your answer that it actually should (?).

regards, Attilio Mattiocco
